channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Europe Considers Response as Hundreds of Migrants Die in Mediterranean Sinkings
item.description: The European Union met in Luxembourg Monday to discuss the disasters as rescuers scrambled to find survivors after ships sank Saturday and early Sunday.
item.dc:creator: JIM YARDLEY
item.media:description: A member of the Italian Coast Guard carried a young migrant rescued from the capsized boat early on Monday in Sicily.

item.title: Mexican Police Capture Leader of Juárez Cartel
item.description: Mexican officials said Sunday that they had captured Jesús Salas Aguayo, who ran the gang’s operations in Ciudad Juárez during the city’s most murderous periods.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETH MALKIN
item.media:description: Jesús Salas Aguayo, who is believed to be the leader of the Juárez Cartel, was arrested on Friday.

item.title: W.H.O. Promises Reform After Criticism Over Ebola Response
item.description: The World Health Organization acknowledged it was not prepared to deal with the Ebola outbreak, and vowed to overhaul the way it handles epidemics.
item.dc:creator: SHERI FINK

item.title: Open Source: Vivid Accounts of War’s Horror Stream From Yemen’s Capital
item.description: Civilians in Yemen’s capital, Sana, documented another day of terror in Twitter dispatches.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Jason Rezaian, Washington Post Reporter Held in Iran, Faces 4 Charges, Lawyer Says
item.description: The charges against the reporter, Jason Rezaian, include espionage and are believed to carry a maximum penalty of 20 years in prison.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:credit: Zoeann Murphy/The Washington Post, via Associated Press

item.title: Poland Demands Apology Over F.B.I. Director’s Holocaust Remarks
item.description: Tensions continued to simmer over comments last week by James B. Comey, the F.B.I. director, that suggested that Poles were Nazi accomplices during the Holocaust.
item.dc:creator: RICK LYMAN
item.media:description: James B. Comey, director of the F.B.I., in March. In a speech last week at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington, he said “In their minds, the murderers and accomplices of Germany, and Poland and Hungary, and so many, many other places didn’t do something evil."

item.title: T.H. Tsien, 105, Dies; Scholar of Chinese Books Rescued 30,000 of Them
item.description: Professor Tsien risked his life in 1941 to smuggle tens of thousands of rare volumes to safety at the Library of Congress amid the Japanese occupation of Shanghai.
item.dc:creator: MARGALIT FOX
item.media:description: T. H. Tsien was one of the world’s renowned scholars of Chinese bibliography and paleography, the study of ancient writing.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Hong Kong University Official Backtracks on Mandatory China Visits
item.description: Ian Holliday, a vice president of the university and a professor of politic science, said on Friday that students who do not wish to go to mainland China should not study at the university, drawing criticism from students who have misgivings about China’s growing influence on the city.
item.dc:creator: ALAN WONG

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Willis Barnstone on Translating Mao and Touring Beijing With Allen Ginsberg
item.description: The poet Willis Barnstone talks about his long flirtation with China and the time Allen Ginsberg visited him there.
item.dc:creator: IAN JOHNSON

item.title: Letter From Europe: Competing Over World War II’s Memory
item.description: The echoes of World War II have never stopped reverberating in France. But perhaps nowhere is the divergence over the memory of the war more acute than between Russia and Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: CELESTINE BOHLEN

item.title: Dot Earth Blog: Sumatran Authorities Arrest Wildlife Dealer Caught with Young Orangutan
item.description: A small victory in efforts to stem Asia’s booming illicit trade in orangutans and other rare wildlife.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: ANDREW C. REVKIN
item.media:description: Authorities in northern Sumatra have arrested a man who allegedly was trafficking in wildlife, including this young orangutan, using Facebook and text messages to connect with buyers.

item.title: Explosion Rips Through Homes in Yemen’s Capital After Airstrike
item.description: An assault by a Saudi-led military coalition set off a huge blast that flattened homes in Sana, part of a campaign against Houthi rebels in the country.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: An explosion in Sana, Yemen, on Monday shattered windows and shook buildings miles away.

item.title: Israeli President Gives Netanyahu Until May 6 to Form Government
item.description: Reuven Rivlin has asked the prime minister to create a coalition after 67 Parliament members recommended that Benjamin Netanyahu continue as prime minister.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, left, with President Reuven Rivlin on Monday.

item.title: Roadside Bomb in Somalia Kills 4 Unicef Workers
item.description: The Shabab, a Somali Islamist extremist group linked to Al Qaeda, claimed responsibility for the attack, The Associated Press reported.
item.dc:creator: ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Mohammad Javad Zarif: A Message From Iran
item.description: We’re ready to talk about ISIS, Syria and Yemen, not just our nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMAD JAVAD ZARIF

item.title: Members of Neo-Fascist Golden Dawn Party in Greece Appear Briefly in Court
item.description: The trial on charges including membership in a criminal organization and murder will decide the fate of the third-largest party in the Parliament.
item.dc:creator: NIKI KITSANTONIS

item.title: Signs Ebola Spreads in Sex Prompt a C.D.C. Warning
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention urged caution for Ebola survivors after a man might have passed the virus to his partner months after recovering from it.
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.dc:creator: SHERI FINK

item.title: Seeking Business, Cuomo Heads to Cuba With a New York Trade Delegation
item.description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo would be the first governor to travel to Cuba since President Obama announced plans to ease relations in December.
item.dc:creator: SUSANNE CRAIG
item.media:credit: Nathaniel Brooks for The New York Times

item.title: Finnish Opposition Wins Vote
item.description: Finland’s opposition Center Party, led by Juha Sipila, won parliamentary elections, but tough talks loom on forming a coalition government.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Yemen Houthi Leader Is Defiant in Face of Saudi Airstrikes
item.description: In a long televised speech, the rebel leader Abdel-Malik al-Houthi gave no indication he was willing to negotiate with Saudi Arabia or to agree to their conditions for a cease-fire.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
